title: Saving the Ocean From Plastic Six-Pack Rings - National Geographic
body: In 2017, cigarette butts were the biggest source of plastic pollution—1,863,838 were collected. National Geographic is committed to reducing plastics pollution. Learn more about our non-profit ...
readable_content: - Guest (2023-12-08): Plastic six-pack rings have been criticized since the 1970s for the harm they cause to wildlife. Despite efforts to regulate their production and use, they remain a significant concern due to their impact on marine life. Some beer companies are exploring alternative ways to package their products, such as using compostable holders or new types of glue. These efforts aim to reduce the amount of plastic waste entering the oceans.
